definitions.body: (c. adj. masc. Je 22:14, cf. Albrecht:ZAW xvi (1896), 83 Kö:Synt. § 251 k) roof-chamber (NH id., Targum [[עֲלִיתָא]], Syr. 9eliyto0 (whence Ar. 9ul=iy=ah; dining-room as loan-wd. Frä:20 f.); Sab. [[עלית]] DHM:Epigr. Denkm. 27);—chamber on roof, cool and secluded : abs. ´[[ע]] Ju Jdg 3:23, Jdg 3:24, Jdg 3:25 (cf. Nes:Marg. 13), 1Ki 17:19, 1Ki 17:23, 2Ki 4:11; cstr. [[עֲלִיַּת הַמְּקֵרָה]] Ju Jdg 3:20, [[־קִיר]]´[[ע]] 2Ki 4:10 roof-chamber with walls (permanent); [[הַשַּׁעַר]] ´[[ע]] 2Sa 19:1, i.e. over the gateway; [[הַפִּנׇּה]] ´[[ע]] Ne 3:31, Ne 3:32 i.e. at a corner of the wall ; [[אָחָז]] ´[[ע]] 2Ki 23:12 (prob. built by A.); sf. [[עֲלִיׇּתוֹ]] 2Ki 1:2 (belonging to Ahaziah);—2Ch 9:4 rd. [[עׂלֽתָיו]] (cf. ‖ 1Ki 10:5); pl. abs. [[עֲלִיּוֹת מְרֻוׇּחִים]] Je 22:14 spacious roof-chambers; in Sol.'s temple acc. to 2Ch 3:9, so sf. [[עֲלִיּתָיו]] 1Ch 28:11; more gen. [[עֲלִיּוֹתָיו]] Je 22:13; ´[[י]]'s chambers in sky Ps 104:3, containing rain, v:Ps 104:13.
